Arab League, the.translation[0].definiti: an organization of Arab countries in North Africa, Northeast Africa and Southwest Asia, which was formed in 1945 to encourage these countries to work together and deal with problems affecting their members. The organization's official title is 'the League of Arab States'.
Arab League, the.translation[1].definiti: an association of Arab states, based in Cairo, which was formed in 1945 and has the aim of protecting and developing the statesâ€™ shared interests
